intro: Hieracium umbellatum subsp. monticola, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is characterized by its rosette of basal leaves and a flowering stem that bears a dense, umbrella-like inflorescence of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, where it thrives in well-drained, sunny conditions.
